The following are some products Hirotada Tokugawa and I figure would
have e=
xisted during the Bakumatsu if they had the means to mass
produce stuff the=
 way we do today:

[old entry already featured at SHQ.com] Red Miburo Energ=
y drink
http://www.shinsengumihq.com/images/fanartRedMiburo.jpg

But once y=
ou are full of masculine energy very likely you'll need this
product which =
was part of the safe sex campaign in Kyoto
(warning this is PG-13, not work=
 safe :P)
http://i162.photobucket.com/albums/t270/secretarytocapt3/bluenigh=
tcondom.jpg
The "Men who protect the city use protection!" slogan was inven=
ted by
the ladies in the red-light district who were concerned that unless
=
the miburo behaved more responsibly, there will be a whole new litter
of ba=
by wolves by next spring...

The Shinsengumi Headquarters ofcourse has a so=
da vending machine
stocked full of this:
http://i162.photobucket.com/albums=
/t270/secretarytocapt3/MTBANDAIDEW.jpg
Mt Bandai is also called Aizu Bandai=
, and as Aizu-han is the patron
domain of the Shinsengumi it would make sen=
se that this is the only
soda they would drink. (actually THE ONLY SODA THE=
Y ARE ALLOWED TO
CONSUME).

Hirotada Tokugawa noted that Aizu also had a mo=
nopoly on ginseng so
this would be the new Mt. Bandai Dew with a bit of the=
 zazzy root.

Very likely the Shinsengumi would shun the competing the "Cho=
shu 7-Up"
 drink (Choshu 7 being a popular term labelling heroes of that do=
main)
or the heavily artificially colored "Satsuma Sunkist" pop.

Not to be=
 beaten, Satsuma forces wished to cater to its own homesick
samurai in Kyot=
o and opened up a chain fast food store symbolized by a
GOLDEN "S" and gaud=
y red and yellow color scheme.  Satsuma samurai are
also pejoratively calle=
d "potato" samurai and no surprise they fry
them up and serve them with a b=
it of salt:
http://i162.photobucket.com/albums/t270/secretarytocapt3/Satsum=
aFries.jpg

They don't believe in "super-sizing" portions, rather they call=
 it
"Saigo-sizing" meals.  WHich means the portions are SO HUGE they can
ev=
en satisfy the apetite of big guys like Saigo Takamori
(fictionalized into =
a heroic figure shown in THE LAST SAMURAI).

For general snacking Shinsengu=
mi reach for Jozai-han rabbit/bunny
jerky. Do to a past product recall, the=
 domain now guarantees that all
their goods contain NO BUNNY FUR. 
http://i=
162.photobucket.com/albums/t270/secretarytocapt3/JozaiJerky.jpg

[notes on =
Jozai Han by Hirotada Tokugawa]
The ancestors of Hayashi Tadataka, daimyo o=
f the Jozai domain, hunted
for rabbits as a new year's dish for Nitta Yoshi=
sada, the ancestor of
Tokugawa Ieyasu. Soon after, the Hayashi family began=
 serving a son of
the Nitta who was the founder of the family which became =
the Tokugawa.

From then on, the head of the Hayashi family would present p=
reserved
rabbit meat to the head of the Matsudaira (later known as Tokugawa=
)
family on new year's day, and in return, the head of the Hayashi
family h=
ad the right to receive his new year's sake cup before any
other retainer o=
f the Matsudaira/Tokugawa clan. 

Because of this, the Hayashi family's "tr=
iple-tomoe" crest
(http://www.kanjistyle.com/gif/JFC003.gif) had the kanji =
for "one" or
"first" beneath it-- which created what was later known as the=
 "Jozai
tomoe," after the Hayashi family's fief
(http://www.asahi-net.or.jp=
/~me4k-skri/han/kamon/jouzai-hayasi-tomoe1.jpg)

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joza=
i domain
